verses.verse: Do not be envious<WH7065> of evil<WH9567> men,<WH376> Nor<WH408> desire<WH183> to be with them;
For their minds<WH3820> devise<WH1897> violence,<WH7701> And their lips<WH8193> talk<WH1696> of trouble.<WH5999>
By wisdom<WH2451> a house<WH1004> is built,<WH1129> And by understanding<WH8394> it is established;<WH3559>
And by knowledge<WH1847> the rooms<WH2315> are filled<WH4390> With all<WH3605> precious<WH3368> and pleasant<WH5273> riches.<WH1952>
A wise<WH2450> man<WH1397> is strong,<WH5797> And a man<WH376> of knowledge<WH1847> increases<WH553> power.<WH3581>
For by wise<WH8458> guidance<WH8458> you will wage<WH6213> war,<WH4421> And in abundance<WH7230> of counselors<WH3289> there is victory.<WH8668>
Wisdom<WH2451> is too high<WH7311> for a fool,<WH191> He does not open<WH6605> his mouth<WH6310> in the gate.<WH8179>
He who plans<WH2803> to do<WH7489> evil,<WH7489> Men will call<WH7121> him a schemer.<WH1167> <WH4209>
The devising<WH2154> of folly<WH200> is sin,<WH9128> And the scoffer<WH9238> is an abomination<WH8441> to men.<WH120>
If you are slack<WH7503> in the day<WH3117> of distress,<WH6869> Your strength<WH3581> is limited.<WH9495>
Deliver<WH5337> those who are being taken<WH3947> away to death,<WH4194> And those who are staggering<WH4131> to slaughter,<WH2027> O<WH518> hold<WH2820> [them] back.<WH2820>

If<WH3588> you say,<WH559> "See,<WH2005> we did not know<WH3045> this,<WH2088>" Does He not consider<WH995> [it] who weighs<WH8505> the hearts<WH3820>? And does He not know<WH3045> [it] who keeps<WH5341> your soul<WH5315>? And will He not render<WH7725> to man<WH120> according to his work<WH6467>?
My son,<WH1121> eat<WH398> honey,<WH1706> for it is good,<WH2896> Yes, the honey<WH5317> from the comb<WH5317> is sweet<WH4966> to your taste;<WH2441>

Know<WH3045> [that] wisdom<WH2451> is thus<WH3651> for your soul;<WH5315> If<WH518> you find<WH4672> [it,] then there<WH3426> will be a future,<WH319> And your hope<WH8615> will not be cut<WH3772> off.<WH3772>
Do not lie<WH693> in wait,<WH693> O wicked<WH7563> man,<WH7563> against the dwelling<WH5116> of the righteous;<WH6662> Do not destroy<WH7703> his resting<WH7258> place;<WH7258>
For a righteous<WH6662> man<WH6662> falls<WH5307> seven<WH7651> times,<WH7651> and rises<WH6965> again, But the wicked<WH7563> stumble<WH3782> in [time of] calamity.<WH9567>
Do not rejoice<WH8055> when your enemy<WH340> falls,<WH5307> And do not let your heart<WH3820> be glad<WH1523> when he stumbles;<WH3782>
Lest<WH6435> the Lord<WH3068> see<WH7200> [it] and be displeased,<WH7489> <WH5869> And He turn<WH7725> away<WH7725> His anger<WH639> from him.
Do not fret<WH2734> because of evildoers,<WH7489> Or be envious<WH7065> of the wicked;<WH7563>
For there will be no<WH3808> future<WH319> for the evil<WH7451> man;<WH7451> The lamp<WH5216> of the wicked<WH7563> will be put<WH1846> out.
My son,<WH1121> fear<WH3372> the Lord<WH3068> and the king;<WH4428> Do not associate<WH6148> with those who are given<WH8132> to change;<WH8132>
For their calamity<WH343> will rise<WH6965> suddenly,<WH6597> And who<WH4310> knows<WH3045> the ruin<WH6365> [that comes] from both<WH8147> of them?
These<WH428> also<WH1571> are sayings of the wise.<WH2450> To show<WH5234> partiality<WH5234> <WH6440> in judgment<WH4941> is not good.<WH2896>
He who says<WH559> to the wicked,<WH7563> "You are righteous,<WH6662>" Peoples<WH5971> will curse<WH6895> him, nations<WH3816> will abhor<WH2194> him;
But to those who rebuke<WH3198> the [wicked] will be delight,<WH5276> And a good<WH9185> blessing<WH1293> will come<WH935> upon them.
He kisses<WH5401> the lips<WH8193> Who gives<WH7725> a right<WH5228> answer.<WH1697>
Prepare<WH3559> your work<WH4399> outside,<WH2351> And make<WH6257> it ready<WH6257> for yourself in the field;<WH7704> Afterwards,<WH310> then, build<WH1129> your house.<WH1004>
Do not be a witness<WH5707> against your neighbor<WH7453> without<WH2600> cause,<WH2600> And do not deceive<WH6601> with your lips.<WH8193>
Do<WH6213> not say,<WH559> "Thus<WH3651> I shall do<WH6213> to him as he has done<WH6213> to me; I will render<WH7725> to the man<WH376> according to his work.<WH6467>"
I passed<WH5674> by the field<WH7704> of the sluggard,<WH6102> And by the vineyard<WH3754> of the man<WH120> lacking<WH2638> sense;<WH3820>

And behold,<WH2009> it was completely<WH3605> overgrown<WH5927> with thistles,<WH7057> Its surface<WH6440> was covered<WH3680> with nettles,<WH2738> And its stone<WH68> wall<WH1447> was broken<WH2040> down.<WH2040>
When I saw,<WH2372> I reflected<WH7896> <WH3820> upon it; I looked,<WH7200> [and] received<WH3947> instruction.<WH4148>
"A little<WH4592> sleep,<WH8142> a little<WH4592> slumber,<WH8572> A little<WH4592> folding<WH2264> of the hands<WH3027> to rest,<WH7901>"
Then your poverty<WH7389> will come<WH935> [as] a robber,<WH1980> And your want<WH4270> like an armed<WH4043> man.<WH376>
